Debs Best Recipes  

White Bean and Spicy Sausage Ragout

Basil & Walnut Pesto:

 1 c tightly packed fresh basil leaves

1 large galic clove, peeled

1/4 c walnuts

1/3 c olive oil

1/3 c freshly grated Parmigiano Reggiano cheese

salt and pepper to taste

 

Ragout:

2 1/2 tbp olive oil, divided

3/4 lb spicy Italian sausage or Chorizo, casings removed

1 small red onion, finely chopped

1 c finely diced carrot

1 c diced butternut squash cut into 1/4 inch pieces

4 large garlic cloves, minced

3 tbs tomato paste

1/2 c white wine or water (or less, depending on how much liquid is in the beans)

4 c cooked white navy or cannellini beans

20 cherry tomatoes, halved (or small can of stewed tomatoes)

1 c chicken broth

salt and pepper to taste

Parmigiano Reggiano shavings to garnish

 

For Pesto:

Combine all the pesto ingredients in the bowl of a food processor.  Puree until smooth.  Set aside until ready to use. 

 

For Ragout:

In a medium saucepan heat 1/2 tbs oil over medium heat.  Add the sausage and saute until cooked through, breaking the sausage into large chunks.  Set aside.  In a large saucepan heat remaining 2 tbs oil over medium heat.  Add the onion, carrot and squash. Cover and sweat the vegetables, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes, or until softened. Add the garlic, cook for 2 minutes. Dissolve the tomato paste in the wine or water, add to the vegetables. Stir in the beans, cherry tomatoes, broth, salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.  Cook, over low heat, partially covered with a lid for 10 minutes.  Remove the lid, add the sausage and continue cooking for another 5-10 minutes or until liquid is reduced, the beans are coated with the sauce and the vegetables are soft.  Divide the ragout between 6 large, shallow bowls.  Top with a dollop of pesto and a few shavings of cheese.
